review:
I contacted Sangeetha mam for my pregnancy treatment. This was my first pregnancy and we were sceptical about whom to go to for checkup and further treatment. Fortunately we found Sangeetha mam. She is someone with lots of experience and very practical in her approach. She is very accurate in  understanding the issue. My entire pregnancy journey was smooth without any hiccups. Around 36th week of my pregnancy, I had severe itching and contacted mam immediately. Went through a growth scan and it was figured out that my amniotic fluid is borderline. Mam suggested two injections for lung maturity of baby on the consecutive days and my delivery was scheduled on the third day. I was induced at around 09:30 pm and delivered my baby boy at 04:03 am (That was a super quick delivery IMO. Her diet and exercises helped a lot here). Mam was following up with duty doctor periodically with duty doctor and she even arrived at the hospital in those early hours. After delivery, I moved to my hometown and suffered from mild pains with episiotomy. Mam followed up with me on phone, took a detailed analysis and suggested treatment which again is accurate and I was able to recover within two days. 

I took 6 months of time to write this review as my baby boy weighed only 2.44 kg at the time of birth and I wanted to make sure everything is fine before writing review. Now, he is a happy little one meeting all his milestones and on track with birth weight chart.

So, overall it's a very positive experience with her and she is also mom-approved doctor. Her multi lingual proficiency needs a special mention.

review:
A year ago we had relocated to Sarjapur area and were in search of good gynaecologist and hospital to get help. Since Motherhood hospital was very close to our house we started researching about the hospital and found it quite good (based on reviews). For selecting the doctor, we took some time. We read all the reviews and after a lot of deliberation we decide to visit Dr. Sangeeta Gomes. And I MUST say that was the best decision we made. Since it is very easy to get misguided in this sensitive issue of ‘planning for a family’, it becomes necessary to get a right kind of doctor and Dr. Gomes is a wonderful doctor. We visited Dr. Gomes in the month of July ’19 for pre-pregnancy check-ups wherein she asked us to undergo a list of tests (which was fair too). When she found out that my fertility rate was very low, she right away suggested some treatments after giving proper counselling. We must say that the doctor has very very positive vibes with very practical attitude. She makes everything sounds doable. However, in our case she turned out to be our ‘lucky charm’. Because after visiting her the next month itself I got conceived all naturally. So, for us she is a lucky mascot. Since then she is our DOCTOR. During the entire pregnancy she gave us right kind of advice and if there was something concerning instead of panicking, she would immediately suggest next steps. We love our consultation sessions which used to be not more than 5 minutes but gave us so much relief (and good laughter sometimes). We always felt she is a very cool doctor who can lighten the whole situation with her style of consulting. I delivered my baby girl during lock-down (April’20) through caesareans delivery (we had decided to go for surgery instead of normal delivery to avoid any risk during this outbreak. Doctor had properly explained to us that C-section is not a bad option and there is no risk too.). We must say that those 9 months went by very smooth and we thank her for every bit. She never suggests any unnecessary tests or medicines. I used to go with list of questions, and she would answer them all. We really recommend DR Sangeeta Gomes and we suggest to at least meet her once. 

About the hospital, we have only good things to talk about just like DR Gomes. Very polite staff and very well managed facility. We have never experienced any chaos or never had any trouble throughout. The nursing staff at the hospital is fantastic and have been very patient with us post-delivery. They extended their support in everything and we really like to thank them specifically (nursing staff at second floor). We certainly recommended Motherhood Sarjapur hospital to everyone.

review:
We are originally from West Bengal and moved to Bangalore for work. Around a year into our marriage, my wife encountered health issues—vaginal infections and irregular periods—leading us to seek medical assistance. Initially, we consulted a doctor who, despite treating her, lacked warmth and delivered distressing news: suggesting that a normal pregnancy might be challenging and advocating for IVF due to an underlying issue.

Devastatingly, after conceiving naturally back in our hometown, we faced a miscarriage at two months into the pregnancy. This loss left us deeply disheartened. However, upon returning to Bangalore and seeking a second opinion, we were fortunate to learn about Sangeeta Mam through a colleague at my workplace.

Sangeeta Mam's approach was a game-changer. Her empathetic demeanor and reassurance filled us with hope. Instead of discouragement, she offered encouragement, sharing her own experiences and stories of other couples who had overcome similar challenges. Under her guidance and care, my wife underwent a tailored treatment plan.

What struck us most was Mam's ability to transform the atmosphere in her office. Couples, initially weighed down by sadness, left her room with smiles, having found comfort, positivity, and renewed hope.

After six months of dedicated care under Mam's guidance, we returned to West Bengal. And thanks to Mam's expertise, my wife successfully delivered our first child—a beautiful baby boy. Sangeeta Mam's consultations were not just medical but also deeply personal and uplifting. Her unwavering support made our journey to parenthood a fulfilling and joyful one.

For anyone facing similar challenges, we wholeheartedly recommend Sangeeta Mam's expert care. You'll not only receive exceptional medical guidance but also find solace and optimism in her compassionate approach.

Today, as we hold our precious baby boy in our arms, we are profoundly grateful to Dr. Sangeeta Gomes for her extraordinary care and expertise. Her commitment to excellence in the field of gynecology and obstetrics is evident in every aspect of her practice. We wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Sangeeta Gomes to anyone seeking top-notch healthcare and support during their pregnancy and childbirth journey.

review:
I don't know how I should start with my story and how this doctor came into my life all of a sudden just like an angel and saved me* ** *** ***** *** ** **** * **** ** ** who came in at a very critical stage of my pregnancy.

I was 7 weeks pregnant and was initially seeing another doctor. Somehow I felt, I was being mislead by my previous doctor. Cutting the long story short, finally I came across an undesirable miscarriage. while announcing the miscarriage upon an ultrasound at the doctor's clinic, the previous doctor tagged my pregnancy as a scar ectopic pregnancy which was earlier never established in my previous scans. I was also told that there was abundant vascularity in and around my uterus for which is why I should go for a Intrasac Methotrate process for abortion. Somehow I was not convinced with this advise and felt this could be life-threatening. 

Immediately  I decided to go for a second opinion. I went to doctor  Sangeet Gomes( found on Google with great reviews) the same evening with all my medical papers. There was a huge queue. However, looking at my condition, she agreed to see me at the earliest. She was super diligent in looking at my history and with her level of knowledge , genuinity and expertise, she could immediately instill confidence in me as a doctor. I got really good vibes from that very moment and requested her to take up my case entirely and treat myself accordingly. She was gracious enough to guide me the best possible way with proper and systematic investigation and medical steps in place. Finally at a very reasonable cost she took me through a Suction and Evacuation process at Manipal Hospital where she ensured I get the right and absolute care. She herself visited me and called up multiple times to check on my status while I was admitted. She did the procedure with amazing backup plans and preparations in place to ensure my physical safety. I am truly humbled by her gesture as a doctor. Even now after two months of my abortion, I still get calls from Care clinic to check on my health and wellbeing. I am deeply indebted to doctor Sangeeta Gomes for being there with me like a " caring mother" if not more.  Thank you doctor. Best regards.

review:
I visited Dr. Sangeeta in first month of my second pregnancy and followed her throughout the pregnancy till my delivery. I am very satisfied with the way Dr. Sangeeta handled my case. One thing that stood out in all the regular checkups is that she is very experienced and gets the signals quite early For Eg. in our case she asked me to control diet to make sure that baby weight doesn't become too much to create complications in Normal Delivery, and it turned out that baby was fully grown(3 KG) when I normally delivered in my 37th week of pregnancy. 

One more thing I observed about the doctor is that she is very patient and avoids unneccessary steps as much as possible. During the 9th month we observed that Baby's heart rate used to spike above 180, while she brought it to our notice and explained the possible complications she did not jump to any action, only when she observed that my AFI(Water Levels) was contineously dropping after a couple of weeks, she asked me to go for NVD by inducing.

When I got admitted and pains were induced, I took pains for several hours without my cervix opening much, I asked the the doctor that I wont have enough strength to push the baby if pains are increased further, doctor actually stopped the pain induction allowed me to have foods and recover my strength and sleep till next early morning, when she resumed inducing the pain. In this whole process we had lost hopes since during my first time I experienced that inducing could lead to C-sec or use of instruments while birthing. So we were constantly asking doctor if we should go for C-sec directly. But Doctor had full confidence in her experience and me too and hence she encouraged me in every possible way for NVD and mentioned that we will try for NVD till the end. review:
I visited Dr. Sangeeta in first month of my first pregnancy and continued with her till my delivery. We were referred to her by a known doctor of us. We are satisfied with her treatment. She tries to communicate in patients mother tongue for better understanding.
Dr had a very systematic approach towards my entire journey. She is very experienced and understands the signals quite early. 
Assessing the situation, she used to suggest the intake of diet and exercises for normal delivery.  Till last minute it was good to go with normal delivery, but I didn't get pains even on 40th week. April 16th was the expected delivery as per the previous scan and Dr suggested to wait till 14th April for pains and get the scan on 14th. In report it showed baby weight as 3.7 kilos and a loop of the cord to neck. So Dr suggested us to go with C-Sec which is safe for both me and baby to avoid any sort of complications especially during lock-down time. She asked to join by night so that she can operate on next day early hrs to avoid any sort of infections(This shows how much she cares about mother and baby). Post delivery also her suggestions were very good. She takes utmost care and avoids any sort of risk (she will not let us go unnecessarily even for medicine unless until its very imp as its corona time). 

We are very happy with the doctor and treatment. I would strongly recommend her for pregnancy related issues.
